description: (stats) The cutoff value for making a decision to reject the null hypothesis; (graphics) A value between 0 and 1 used to control the levels of transparency in a plot
title: PsyTeachR QFA Ch. 11

description: The false negative rate we accept for a statistical test.

description: When a test concludes there is no effect when there really is an effect

description: When a test concludes there is an effect when there really is no effect

description: A proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence as a starting point for further investigation.

description: The probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is false.

description: A number between 0 and 1 where 0 indicates impossibility of the event and 1 indicates certainty

description: The extent to which the findings of a study can be repeated with new samples from the same population.

description: A subset of the population that you wish to make an inference about through your test.
